VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The server was expecting the parameter ‘type’ which was not provided by the client
This error can be a generic error, see the error message for more details
The server was expecting the parameter ‘name’ which was not provided by the client
The server was expecting the parameter ‘value’ which was not provided by the client

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: Variable already exists and cannot be overwritten
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The server is refusing to overwrite an existing variable because the parameter “overwrite” was enabled

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: The value cannot be parsed, expected JSON data
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The server was expecting JSON data in the ‘value’ parameter but couldn't parse
This error is returned when there is invalid data in the ‘value’ parameter which is not applicable to the data type, the message will contain more information about the error
The changes cannot be made because the maximum size for this Application’s storage for settings/variables has exceeded. You need to remove data to free up space
The requested variable does not exist in the current context

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: Append not applicable to this variable type
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The server refuses to append data to this variable type because it’s not supported, only list and arrays are supported
The parameter ‘by’ only accepts “index” or “key” as values

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: Delete is not applicable to this variable type
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The server is refusing to delete data from a variable because it’s only applicable to List & Array types

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: Cannot remove value by Index on array data type
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: You can’t delete data by index on a array data type since arrays are a key and value pair
